pr_title: HBASE-23682 Fix NPE when disable DeadServerMetricRegionChore

timeline.bodyText:
I think it is usually better to do nullable annotations with issues like this to make the contracts clear at the API level.  It also helps static code analyzers to catch issues like these.
For example you could do @nullable in this case..
timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: OK
replies.author: binlijin

timeline.bodyText: nit: Guess this is redundant if the method accepts null values.
timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: Yes.
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: I mean .. we can get rid of this if block? addChore has a similar check right?
replies.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: I know it can  be removed,  add it to show just where is wrong actually and cause the problem.
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: nit: Remove the if condition here, since the method's args are Nullable?
replies.author: bharathv

timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: yes, fix it
replies.author: binlijin

timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: OK
replies.author: binlijin

timeline.bodyText: Again looks like a remnant of copy+paste from TestAssignment...
timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: fix it
replies.author: binlijin

timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: I think it's better to have a shutdown, instead of kill the cluster, in tearDown. Also seems that an assertion in this test is missing.
replies.author: HorizonNet

replies.bodyText:
The test is failed  when startMiniCluster without this patch.
[INFO] Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore
[ERROR] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 210.246 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore
[ERROR] org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore.testDeadServerMetricRegionChore  Time elapsed: 210.054 s  <<< ERROR!
java.io.IOException: Shutting down
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore.testDeadServerMetricRegionChore(TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore.java:60)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Master not initialized after 200000ms
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore.testDeadServerMetricRegionChore(TestDeadServerMetricRegionChore.java:60)
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: Is the shutdown failing or because it is part of the tearDown?
replies.author: HorizonNet

replies.bodyText:
The shutdown has no problem, i already change killMiniHBaseCluster
to shutdownMiniCluster.
replies.author: binlijin

timeline.bodyText:
Still don't understand why we cant move startMiniCluster() to setUp() and shutDownMiniCLuster() to tearDown().
I get the point that without the patch, startMiniCluster() throws, but with the patch, it shouldn't, right? Did I miss something.
timeline.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: Yes, without the patch HMaster will abort when startup so startMiniCluster throws exception, with the patch it will not.
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: So, I think the only pending question is ...why not move shutdownMiniCluster() to tearDown()? I think @HorizonNet is also asking the same thing.
replies.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: Ok, fix it.
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: Didn't address this yet?
replies.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: shutdownMiniCluster() already move to tearDown(), shoud have addressed it.
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: You mean change "/**" to "/*" ?    I see other tests all use "/**" no one use "/*"
replies.author: binlijin

replies.bodyText: /** is interpreted as a javadoc in IDEs. If you notice others' changes, people are switching to /* incrementally in their patches (files they are touching). Now that you are adding a new class, it is better to start with /*.
replies.author: bharathv

replies.bodyText: OK, thanks for you explanation.
replies.author: binlijin
